The guidelines provide a framework for implementing 108 services during the pandemic. It is noted that the practice 109 of EP and CIED management in Australia is varied amongst 110 public and private hospitals, regional and remote areas, and 111 in outreach clinics. The application of these recommenda-112 tions will therefore need to be tailored to local models of 113 service delivery. 114 In response to the CSANZ board request, the Chair of the 115 Heart Rhythm Council summoned the formation of the Heart 116 Rhythm Council COVID-19 Pandemic working group. The 117 group is formed by the authors listed in this document, 118 whose responsibility it was to contribute to the original 119 source document, and who will continue provide frequent 120 updates in six Domains: 121 1 Implementing a Framework for Altered Services.

The COVID-19 pandemic poses a significant stress on health resources in Australia. The Heart Rhythm Council of the Cardiac Society of Australia and New Zealand aims to provide a framework for efficient resource utilisation balanced with competing risks when appropriately treating patients with cardiac arrhythmias. This document provides practical recommendations for the electrophysiology (EP) and cardiac implantable electronic devices (CIED) services in Australia. The document will be updated regularly as new evidence and knowledge is gained with time.

One third 768 of the patients (35.3%) had previous CVD, and 52 (27.8%) 769 patients experienced an acute myocardial injury. Troponin T TnT) elevation likely represents myocardial injury from 771 either myocarditis, infarction with plaque rupture or diffuse 772 ischaemia from hypoxia. Mortality among patients with CVD 773 and elevated TnT levels was 69.44% (25 of 36), compared to 774 7.62% (8 of 105) among patients without CVD and acute 775 myocardial injury. Patients with CVD were more prone to 776 TnT elevation (54.5% vs 13.2%), and patients with elevated 777 TnT had more frequent malignant arrhythmias. The overall 778 incidence of VT or VF in this cohort of sick patients with 779 frequent underlying CVD (and a total mortality of 23%) was 780 5.9%.
